profile.title: Backend @ CityMall | Go/Golang, C# | Previously LeadSquared, SocGen
profile.description:
An experienced developer currently working at Citymall with prior experience in investment banking and marketing domain. My primary focus is in Backend in Go working on REST and GRPC Microservices. My philosophy always has been to write code which is simple, collaborative and takes advantages of modern development practices. I understand that work is best done in a team and I constantly strive to be a team player. I am a quick learner and can pick up technologies best suited for any task. 

In the past I have worked in C#, Python and interacted with domains such as Frontend development and Deep Learning. also dabble in tools such as Docker and Kubernetes to help my workflow and understand the modern CI pipeline. 

Prior to Citymall, I was working at LeadSquared and Societe Generale working in C# and .NET Core.

challenges.description:
• API Rebuild and Optimisation Independently re‑built and managed a high‑traffic API (600,000 DAU and 500 RPS) in Go
from the ground up, achieving 50% reduction in resource consumption and costs over old APIs and 30‑50%
improvement in response times
• Uptime Enhancement And Scaling Leveraged K6, HPA, and Keda to boost uptime of core services and APIs from 98% to 99.5%
which resulted in a substantial increase in revenue during peak loads, driving up to 20L INR per hour
• Inventory Management Revamp Solely revamped and optimised inventory management across all warehouses and sellers by
leveraging Go and gRPC enabling real‑time stock views for faster order fulfilment(processing 100,000 warehouse events per
minute at peak) which significantly reduced loss and enhanced ordering experience for customers
• Performance Monitoring Observability Spearheaded the movement for better logging, observability and monitoring using
Loki, Grafana and Prometheus that is now implemented across all engineering teams

‑ reduced the operational costs, fastened the release cycle and make them easily scalable
• Service Reliability Using Sentry and automated testing suites, improved the process to identify and eliminate bugs
for high throughput APIs managed by me

• Improved the core automation engine as part of a team to reduce execution times and lag for customers written in C#
• Independently developed a PoC to move engine from C# to Apache AirFlow, Python and Docker ‐ reducing cost and operational complexity for business
• Used AWS to monitor performance of the engine

• Independently managed a critical finance and audit C# application that served 3000+ analysts daily in the back office. This included handling issues and incorporating new features in close collaboration with business teams

• Assumed a pivotal role in knowledge sharing across the team, mentored new team members, fostering knowledge sharing and skill development
• As a junior team member, actively contributed to design and architecture discussions with various teams, underscoring a commitment to promoting best practices
• Exhibited a high level of responsibility by handling end to end release cycles for all applications including planning new technical features, ensuring bug free release and collaborating with different teams to add new functionality

• Developed portal for basket of stocks using Javascript and Python, using public APIs and scraping Bloomberg Data
• Reduced efforts for E2E Testing of enterprise application with Selenium

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription: I would like a job where I'm part of the team that creates or envisions a product and then brings it to life. I have had the fortune of working on products that have stood the test of time and now looking to be part of a team that takes this journey. I want to work on making a vision come to life, use various tools to make it possible and scale it to make the impact we want.
manfredSpecificData.goodPractices: I try to be open to ideas and people. Being honest and empathetic is the best way in my opinion to collaborate with people and make things possible. To me it is important that you acknowledge mistakes and improve them, rather than work on avoiding them. The quotes from Stormlight Archive - "journey before destination" and "It's not the first one, is it? It's the next one. Always the next step, Dalinar." are the ones that resonate my philosophy the most.
